docs.text: these days the lack of originality in hollywood reflects itself in the deluge of remakes .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but , only a few years ago , before wes craven publicly made fun of the practice , sequels had been more popular among hollywood producers .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: sequels also used to be popular among directors and movie stars whose careers went south .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the way to regain popularity and prestige , they thought , was the use the same formulas , characters and story lines that brought them success in the first place .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: one of such celebrity was eddie murphy , black comedian of 1980s whose career was in big decline during the first part of this decade .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in order to return to the spotlight , he chose to resurrect the franchise created by his most popular film , beverly hills cop , 1984 action comedy that had already spawned the sequel in 1987 .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: seven years later , for the third instalment , he used the directorial service of john landis , another fading star , with whom he successfully collaborated twice - in trading places and coming to america .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: this time , however , third time wasn't the charm and beverly hills iii was failure .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: eddie murphy had to wait few more years for real comeback .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: eddie murphy here plays axel foley , fast-talking streetwise detroit policeman , who raids illegal chop shop .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the routine police action ends in tragedy , when the criminals kill foley's boss .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: determined to bring the killers to justice , foley realises that their leader is ellis de wald ( timothy carhart ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: when it turns out that de wald happens to be security chief for wonderland theme park in los angeles , foley goes back to los angeles .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: there , with the help of his old friend , local policeman rosewood ( judge rheinhold ) , foley would clash with money counterfeit ring .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: ten years has passed since the original and times are definitely different .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in this decade , the contrast between blue collar detroit and yuppie beverly hills , which provided a lot of gags in 1984 film , simply doesn't work .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: screenwriter steven e . de souza provides another conflict , this time between the childish sillyness of the good guys and business-like professionalism of the bad guys .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: since foley belongs to the former , his character had to watch his language , and the tone of the film in general is more infantile .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: unfortunately , this film still belongs to action movie genre , and there is too much violence for little children .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: nice example is the humorous scene in the beginning , which turns into standard ramboesque bloodbath .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: unlike donner with the lethal weapon series , landis simply can't balance the comedy with " regular " action , and the result is a film that fails in both aspects .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: action scenes are sometimes interesting , but not too spectacular ( at the end , scenery of wonderland is more fascinating than the action itself ) ; humour , on the other hand , falls flat .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: to make even worse , some minor characters from 1984 film gets unnecessary and sometimes irritating overexposure ( especially art expert turned into arms dealer , played by bronson pinchot ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in the end , although the film provided some entertainment , viewers , at least critical ones , would probably be happy to know that there aren't any plans for beverly hills iv .
docs.label: negative
